common.options

Class Options

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.CObject
      • common.options.Options

  • public final class Options
extends CObject
    The Options class is the class containing the options for executables (an application and a stage ) in the Poros framework. It is the software representation of the execution control file is used to modify the default execution of an application or a stage.
    Author:
    Vincent Mirian
    Date:
    Dec 8, 2017

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Options(java.lang.String filename)
      Initializes a newly created Options with its contents equivalent to those of the parameter filename.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNumStageArgValue(java.lang.String stage)
      Returns the number of argument(s) in the stage defined by parameter stage
      Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getStageArgValueAtIdx(java.lang.String stage, int index)
      Returns the value of the argument at the index defined by parameter index for the stage defined by parameter stage
      java.lang.String getStageArgValueName(java.lang.String stage, java.lang.String arg)
      Returns the value of the argument defined by parameter arg for the stage defined by parameter stage
      java.lang.String getStageName(java.lang.String stage)
      Returns the value of the stage defined by parameter stage

    • Constructor Detail

      • Options

        public Options(java.lang.String filename)
        Initializes a newly created Options with its contents equivalent to those of the parameter filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - the path to the execution control file

    • Method Detail

      • getStageName

        public java.lang.String getStageName(java.lang.String stage)
        Returns the value of the stage defined by parameter stage
        Parameters:
        stage - the name of the stage
        Returns:
        if the parameter stage is present, return the value of the stage defined by parameter stage, otherwise null

      • getStageArgValueName

        public java.lang.String getStageArgValueName(java.lang.String stage,
                                             java.lang.String arg)
        Returns the value of the argument defined by parameter arg for the stage defined by parameter stage
        Parameters:
        stage - the name of the stage
        arg - the name of the argument
        Returns:
        if the argument is present in the stage, return the value of the argument defined by parameter arg for the stage defined by parameter stage, otherwise null

      • getNumStageArgValue

        public int getNumStageArgValue(java.lang.String stage)
        Returns the number of argument(s) in the stage defined by parameter stage
        Parameters:
        stage - the name of the stage
        Returns:
        the number of argument(s) in the stage defined by parameter stage

      • getStageArgValueAtIdx

        public Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getStageArgValueAtIdx(java.lang.String stage,
                                                                     int index)
        Returns the value of the argument at the index defined by parameter index for the stage defined by parameter stage
        Parameters:
        stage - the name of the stage
        index - index of the argument
        Returns:
        if the index is within the bounds (0 <= bounds < this.getNumStageArgValue(stage)), return a pair instance with the first element containing the name of the argument, and, the second element containing the value of the argument, otherwise return null
